questions.text: Match the following
Congenital anomaly as shown in pic is due to involvement of which of the following?

A 62-year-old woman presents with complaints of urinary urgency, frequency, and urge incontinence. After excluding other causes, she is diagnosed with overactive bladder (OAB). Which of the following drugs is most appropriate for symptom control in this condition?
A 2-year-old child suspected of a genetic disorder is diagnosed of Leukaemia. Karyotype is as given below. Likely diagnosis
A 58-year-old man with primary open-angle glaucoma is prescribed Netarsudil. Which of the following best describes its mechanism of action and the most common adverse effect?

options.label: A
options.text: Increases aqueous humor outflow via uveoscleral pathway; iris pigmentation

options.label: B
options.text: Reduces aqueous production by blocking beta receptors; dry eyes

options.label: C
options.text: Inhibits rho kinase to enhance trabecular outflow; conjunctival hyperemia

options.label: D
options.text: Carbonic anhydrase inhibition to decrease aqueous formation; renal stones

questions.correct_answer: C. Inhibits rho kinase to enhance trabecular outflow; conjunctival hyperemia

questions.text: Which of the following antidepressants is a norepinephrine-dopamine reuptake inhibitor and is associated with weight neutrality and smoking cessation benefit?

A 48-year-old patient with heterozygous familial hypercholesterolemia is already on maximumdose atorvastatin and ezetimibe, but LDL-C remains high. The physician considers adding alirocumab. Which of the following is a correct statement about alirocumab mechanism of action?

options.label: A
options.text: It increases the expression of HMG-CoA reductase.

options.label: B
options.text: It is an inhibitor of ATP- Lyase

options.label: C
options.text: It is the oral NPC1LI inhibitor

questions.correct_answer: D. It enhances LDL receptor recycling.

questions.text: Read the Following statements regarding Action A. Triceps Brachii – Extension at Elbow B. Supraspinatus – Initiation of Abduction of shoulder C. Pectoralis major – Flexion, Adduction & Medial Rotation of shoulder D. Lumbricals – MCP Flexion, IP Extension

55 years old male presenting with periorbital edema, facial puffiness and massive proteinuria Renal biopsy has revealed following features under Direct Immunofluorescence (DIF) and electron microscopy (EM) as shown in given picture. All of the following are true regarding this condition except:

options.label: A
options.text: Circulating antibodies to PLAR will correlate prognosis.

options.label: D
options.text: Mesangial deposits will be seen on EM

questions.correct_answer: D. Mesangial deposits will be seen on EM

questions.text: A 66-year-old man with atrial fibrillation is brought to the emergency department after a fall, with signs of intracranial hemorrhage on CT scan. A new described neurological disorder is found to affect multiple members in the family over 3 generations. In the first generation which consisted of two sisters and one brother all were found to be affected. In the second generation all children of first generation sisters were affected but children of sons were spared. In the third generation all children of second generation women were affected but not the children of second generation men. The mode of inheritance is -
Given below are four examples of transport across the cell membrane with the type of transport. Which of the following is incorrect?

options.label: A
options.text: Transport of glucose from the intestinal lumen into intestinal epithelial cell is by secondary active co-transport

options.label: B
options.text: Transport of glucose into adipocytes is by facilitated diffusion

options.label: C
options.text: Movement of Ca++ from cardiac muscle cell to the ECF during muscle relaxation is by Na+-dependent counter transport

options.label: D
options.text: Movement of K+ ions out of the nerve cell during the downstroke phase of the action potential is by facilitated diffusion

questions.correct_answer: D. Movement of K+ ions out of the nerve cell during the downstroke phase of the action potential is by facilitated diffusion

questions.text: While playing football, the ball hits a 12-year-old boy on his shin with considerable force. He sits on the ground and starts rubbing the area to reduce the pain. Inhibition of pain signals by tactile stimulation of the skin is mediated by which type of afferent neurons from the mechanoreceptors?
A 23-year-old male with chronic liver disease was evaluated and found to be having findings given below. This condition is most likely to be associated with which of the following alterations?

options.label: B
options.text: Mallory denk bodies are seen on liver biopsy

questions.correct_answer: B. Mallory denk bodies are seen on liver biopsy

They occur around 6–8 times per month, often triggered by sleep deprivation and stress. He self-medicates with over-the-counter painkillers with partial relief. options.label: B
options.text: It produces its effect by increasing the distal tubular permeability to sodium

options.label: C

options.text: Reabsorption of urea is more in the inner medullary duct than in the TAL during antidiuresis

options.label: C

questions.correct_answer: A. Urea reabsorption in the PCT is lesser than in the cortical CD

questions.text: Which of the following statement regarding CKD associated MDB is TRUE

options.label: A
options.text: Osteomalacia is the most common type of MBD

options.label: B
options.text: Hypophosphatemia is characteristic of advanced CKD

options.label: C
options.text: Chronic acidaemia contributes to demineralisation of bones and MBD.

questions.correct_answer: C. Chronic acidaemia contributes to demineralisation of bones and MBD.

questions.text: A 28-year-old male sustains a penetrating knife injury to the back. Examination reveals: • Flaccid paralysis and areflexia at the L1 level • Ipsilateral spastic weakness and loss of vibration/proprioception below L1 • Contralateral loss of pain and temperature sensation beginning at L3 dermatome • Preserved bowel and bladder function What is the most precise localization of the spinal cord lesion?

options.label: A
options.text: Complete transection of spinal cord at L1

options.label: B
options.text: Right hemisection of spinal cord at L1

options.label: C
options.text: Right hemisection of spinal cord at L2

options.label: D
options.text: Left hemisection of spinal cord at T12

questions.correct_answer: B. Right hemisection of spinal cord at L1

questions.text: On shining a torch light in right eye, there was constriction seen in both eyes, but when light was shown to left eye, neither of pupil constricts. There was no anisocoria. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 72-year-old male presents with acute left-sided hemiplegia and aphasia that started 3 hours ago. BP is 170/95 mmHg. Non-contrast CT brain shows no hemorrhage. Labs: Platelet count 90,000/mm³, INR 1.2, serum glucose 130 mg/dL, and creatinine 1.1 mg/dL. He has no prior stroke or surgery. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step?

options.label: A
options.text: Proceed with IV alteplase at 0.9 mg/kg after informed consent

options.label: B
options.text: Defer thrombolysis due to low platelet count

options.label: D
options.text: Repeat CT after 1 hour to rule out early infarct signs

questions.correct_answer: B. Defer thrombolysis due to low platelet count

A 25-year-old woman with type 1 diabetes presents with vomiting, Kussmaul respiration, and confusion. Labs reveal: • Blood glucose: 510 mg/dL • Arterial pH: 7.05 • HCO₃⁻: 9 mEq/L • Serum potassium: 5.2 mEq/L She is started on IV fluids and insulin infusion. After 2 hours, her serum potassium drops to 3.2 mEq/L. What is the most appropriate next step?

options.label: A
options.text: Continue insulin at the same rate and monitor potassium

options.label: B
options.text: Stop insulin immediately and administer dextrose

options.label: C
options.text: Continue insulin and give IV potassium supplementation

options.label: D
options.text: Administer sodium bicarbonate to correct acidosis

questions.correct_answer: C. Continue insulin and give IV potassium supplementation

questions.text: A 60-year-old man with a history of alcoholic liver disease presents with ascites. Diagnostic ascitic fluid analysis done. Which of the following ascitic fluid results is most likely to suggest that ascites is due to cirrhosis?
questions.correct_answer: D. Serum ascites albumin gradient >1.1 g/dL

questions.text: A 42-year-old male presents with chronic fatigue, salt craving, postural dizziness, and progressive skin darkening over knuckles and oral mucosa. His labs reveal: • Serum Na⁺: 124 mEq/L • Serum K⁺: 5.8 mEq/L • Morning cortisol: 4 μg/dL (low) • Plasma ACTH: 950 pg/mL (↑↑) • ACTH stimulation test: cortisol rises to 6 μg/dL after 60 min Which of the following is the most accurate interpretation?
questions.correct_answer: C. Consistent with primary adrenal insufficiency

questions.text: A 62-year-old woman undergoes mammography to investigate a mass discovered on breast exam in the upper outer quadrant of her left breast. She has a variety of questions, including further workup and possible treatment options. Which of the following patients with breast cancer would be the best candidate for hormonal therapy?

questions.text: A 60-year-old patient with ARDS is on mechanical ventilation. The intensivist increases PEEP from 5 to 10 cm H2O. What is the primary physiological rationale for increasing PEEP in this setting?

options.label: C
options.text: To prevent alveolar collapse and improve oxygenation

questions.correct_answer: C. To prevent alveolar collapse and improve oxygenation

questions.text: A patient presented to hospital after prolonged exposure in severe cold condition Frostbitten tissues should be immediately treated by:

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.text: There is ventilation perfusion mismatch from surfactant deficiency

questions.text: A 30-year-old male undergoes a forearm tendon repair under IVRA using lignocaine. Ten minutes after drug administration, he complains of dizziness and perioral numbness. What is the most likely cause?

options.label: B
options.text: Systemic absorption due to tourniquet failure

options.label: D
options.text: Delayed onset of action of lignocaine

questions.correct_answer: B. Systemic absorption due to tourniquet failure

questions.text: False statement about testicular tumour is?

options.label: A
options.text: 95% of testicular tumors are germ cell tumor

options.label: C
options.text: Extragonadal germ cell tumor has better prognosis and twice the survival as compared to germ cell tumour.

options.label: D
options.text: Most common urological tumor of young age

questions.correct_answer: C. Extragonadal germ cell tumor has better prognosis and twice the survival as compared to germ cell tumour.

questions.text: Early hospital discharge is defined as the discharge of a newborn earlier than 48 hours following vaginal delivery or 96 hours following cesarean delivery. Of the following, the MOST common reason for re-admission to the hospital within 7 days following an early discharge is

A 55-year-old man collapses suddenly in a shopping mall. A bystander calls emergency services and starts CPR immediately. Which of the following correctly represents the adult out-of-hospital "Chain of Survival" as per the latest AHA guidelines?

options.label: A
options.text: Rapid defibrillation → Early CPR → Advanced care → Activation of EMS → Post-arrest care

options.label: B
options.text: Early CPR → Post-arrest care → Rapid defibrillation → EMS activation → Rehabilitation

options.label: C
options.text: Recognition and EMS activation → High-quality CPR → Defibrillation → Advanced care → Post-arrest care

options.label: D
options.text: EMS activation → Transport to hospital → CPR → Defibrillation → ICU care

questions.correct_answer: C. Recognition and EMS activation → High-quality CPR → Defibrillation → Advanced care → Post-arrest care

questions.text: A 20 year old female patient consumed a cleaning product containing 90% sodium hydroxide. She is having complete dysphagia. What is the best step in management?
“Mickey Mouse Sign” during B-mode duplex ultrasound imaging comprises:

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Anterior tibial artery, Dorsalis pedis artery Extensor hallucis tendon

options.label: C
options.text: Common femoral vein, Common femoral artery and Great Saphenous vein

options.label: D
options.text: Brachial artery, Basilica vein and Biceps tendon

questions.correct_answer: C. Common femoral vein, Common femoral artery and Great Saphenous vein
